items: Start on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Inhale and arch your back, lifting your head and tailbone towards the ceiling. This is the “cat” position.
Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin to your chest and bringing your tailbone towards your knees. This is the “cow” position.
Repeat the cat and cow positions for several breaths, moving smoothly and slowly between the two positions.
Focus on the movement of your spine and the stretch in your back.
Finish by returning to a neutral spine position.
Improves spinal flexibility and mobility
Stretches the back, hips, and abdomen
Relieves tension and stress in the spine and neck
Increases circulation to the spinal discs and nerves
Helps improve posture and alignment
Can be done as a gentle warm-up or cool-down exercise
Abdominal muscles
Back muscles
Neck muscles
Chest muscles
Cat Cow Stretch with arm reach
Cat Cow Stretch with leg extension
Cat Cow Stretch with spinal twist
Cat Cow Stretch with hip circles
Cat Cow Stretch with neck stretch
